sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukrainians say Russian forces are moving back from areas they'd occupied but may now be focusing on new targets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russian police detain at least 200 anti-war protesters across the country, but support for Putin's military operation continues to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's the final countdown. Hungary's Viktor Orban and Peter Markizaj appealed to voters one last time before Sunday's parliamentary election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: At least 35 people are thought to have been killed in the southern Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Rescue workers have continued to dismantle the rubble and search for victims after the strike blasted a hole through the side of the building in central Mykolaiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russian forces attacked the regional state government's offices on Tuesday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the city of Brivari is back in the hands of the Ukrainians after being occupied by Russians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Many residents of Brivari have returned to their homes and shops are starting to reopen in the city which is 20 kilometers east of the capital Kiev. I would say that life is not very good she says. All the shops are closed and many people have run out of food. The bread hasn't been delivered for three weeks now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russian forces are loosening their grip on Kyiv, but Ukraine's president Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Russian forces are now massing in the east and south of the country, especially in the areas held by pro-Russian separatists in Donetsk and Luhansk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's thought they will then push north towards Kharkiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But even more peaceful parts of Ukraine, like Odessa, cannot be safe havens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As our correspondent reports, three missiles were fired from Crimea on Friday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He says the missiles that were launched from Crimea to this region of Odessa end up shaking the calm that's been lived in recent days here, where people began to try to resume normal life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But these missiles that passed during the night and were shot down by Ukrainian anti-aircraft batteries provoked new moments of panic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Sergio Ferreira da Almeida, Euronews, Odessa, Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis says he may travel to war-torn Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The pontiff made the announcement to a plane full of journalists en route to the island of Malta.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Postponed for two years on account of the coronavirus pandemic, the focus of the visit was supposed to be on the plight of migrants but his holiness did not ignore the invasion of ukraine from his signature popemobile the head of the roman catholic church greeted large crowds in valetta before meeting president bella and the first lady at the grandmaster's palace the pope blasted russia's president vladimir put Putin for launching a savage war in his most critical message yet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Francis also denounced the European Union for turning away Libyan migrants and said Europe must show solidarity in welcoming them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Human rights groups have condemned the EU programme which trains Libyan coastguards to patrol and stop migrant smuggling operations before bringing would-be refugees back to shore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While frontline Mediterranean countries such as Italy have backed the initiative, activists say they have documented widespread abuse in detention camps where returning migrants are being held.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This woman carrying a bouquet of white tulips was escorted away by Russian authorities under the heavy snow in the capital Zaryady Park, a short distance from the Kremlin. The Human Rights Project OVD info says Russian police

sentences.sentence: According to a new poll released by the independent, non-governmental Nevada Center, support for President Vladimir Putin is rising.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Findings show that Putin's approval rating rose from 71 percent in February to 83 percent in March.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I decided to stay here until something changes, he says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I was here last month before all that unpleasant mess.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I don't want to be in a country which rages a war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's why I arrived.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I don't know how long I will stay here, he says, but this year I definitely will. Some months, a year, maybe even more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There are no problems booking hotels, but apartments are harder to come by, and some Georgians will let Ukrainians stay in their flats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I've been renting out apartments for about five years now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I have two flats in the old part of Tbilisi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I have had clients from all over the world, from Europe, from Asia, also from Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I also hosted Ukrainians, but for now, considering the ongoing events, we prioritise citizens for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In mid-March, more than 30,000 Russians arrived in the country. More than 12,500 are still there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: During an entire period of month, you have tenfold number of Russians arriving in Georgia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It causes some suspicion whether these are really refugees or these are politically driven out from Russia and kind of thinking how to save their businesses etc. Or these are so-called subversive elements that are specific and purpose sent to Georgia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But Georgian security agencies fear some Russian paramilitary groups might arrive, as they did in Ukraine in 2014.

sentences.sentence: Just one of the slogans the United for Hungary coalition has repeated during its campaign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the wake of Sunday's parliamentary election, the opposition united under Peter Marquis Zay told his supporters we are at the gates of victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After 12 years in power, Prime Minister Viktor Orb√°n is presenting himself as a guarantor of stability in turbulent times and says voters must choose between war or peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While the margins are narrowing, his nationalist, conservative Fidesz party is still leading in the polls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This pensioner says, I am sure that Fidesz will win because our people are shamefully more concerned about the price of gas than what is happening around us and in our neighbouring country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: There has to be a fight against this regime in general, this administration says, and definitely against social injustice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: To redress the inequalities that have become very noticeable in Hungary.

sentences.sentence: The weekend has arrived, and civilians in Mitrovica, northern Kosovo, are making the most of the April sunshine, enjoying their coffees outdoors.

sentences.sentence: Serbia is preparing to go to the polls on Sunday for the country's parliamentary and presidential elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While ethnic Serbs in Kosovo were allowed to vote in previous elections, polling stations will remain closed on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Albin Kerti says constituents can only cast their ballots at a liaison office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But ethnic Serbs in Mitrovica say they feel abandoned by the Serbian government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This can only happen to us, thanks to those down south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: What do you mean?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is well known who, those who are bothered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We are a nuisance to them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Both governments should think about us and about our rights and it is my right to vote. Who asks the people today? No one. Following recent demonstrations, locals hope Sunday's election will not fuel renewed tensions. We hope it will be peaceful, always and forever. No one needs a war, absolutely no one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: With the help of God, not only tomorrow or the day after tomorrow, but always, there should be peace among the people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kosovo declared independence from Serbia in 2008, but experts say it is important for the government to reach out to the Serbian minority. Kosovo's Serbs will never be comfortable if they are guided by a narrative that comes from Belgrade, he says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: If they do not have a voice, a mission of their own, for life here, for their rights, then they will never be comfortable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On Sunday, ethnic Serbs with Serbian citizenship will also be able to travel to Serbian cities on the border with Kosovo if they want to take the opportunity to vote.
